slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचऊर्ध्वमूलमध:शाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम् ।छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित् ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: They speak of the eternal Ashvattha tree with its roots above and branches below, whose leaves are the Vedas; he who knows this tree is the knower of the Vedas.

slokas: अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखागुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवाला: ।अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानिकर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: Below and above spread its branches, nourished by the qualities, with sense objects as its shoots. Below in the human world, its roots are extended, binding through actions.

slokas: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यतेनान्तो न चादिर्न च सम्प्रतिष्ठा ।अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूल-मसङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्त्वा ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: The form of this tree is not perceived here, nor its end, nor its beginning, nor its foundation. Having cut down this firmly rooted Ashvattha tree with the strong weapon of detachment...

slokas: तत: पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यंयस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूय: ।तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्येयत: प्रवृत्ति: प्रसृता पुराणी ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: Then, that state should be sought, having attained which they do not return again. To that primeval Person, from whom the ancient activity has spread forth, I seek refuge.

slokas: निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषाअध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामा: ।द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ता: सुखदु:खसंज्ञै-र्गच्छन्त्यमूढा: पदमव्ययं तत् ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Free from pride and delusion, having conquered the evils of attachment, ever dwelling in the Self, their desires having completely ceased, liberated from the dualities known as pleasure and pain, the undeluded attain that imperishable state.

slokas: न तद्भ‍ासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावक: ।यद्ग‍त्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: The sun does not illuminate that, nor the moon, nor the fire. That is my supreme abode, having gone to which they do not return.

slokas: ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूत: सनातन: ।मन:षष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: An eternal portion of Myself becomes the individual soul in the living world, drawing to itself the mind and the six senses, which rest in nature.

slokas: शरीरं यदवाप्‍नोति यच्च‍ाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वर: ।गृहीत्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: When the soul acquires a body and when it leaves it, it takes these with it, like the wind carrying scents from their sources.

slokas: श्रोत्रं चक्षु: स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च ।अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Ears, eyes, touch, taste, and smell, and also the mind; this (the self) engages with objects through them.

slokas: उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वाऽपि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् ।विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुष: ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: The deluded do not see the soul when it departs, resides, or enjoys, endowed with qualities. But those with the eye of knowledge see.

slokas: यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् ।यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतस: ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: The striving yogis perceive him established in themselves, but those whose minds are not cultivated, even though striving, do not perceive him.

slokas: यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भ‍ासयतेऽखिलम् ।यच्च‍न्द्रमसि यच्च‍ाग्न‍ौ तत्तेजो विद्धि मामकम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: The light that is in the sun, which illumines the whole world, and that which is in the moon and in the fire, know that light to be Mine.

slokas: गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा ।पुष्णामि चौषधी: सर्वा: सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मक: ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: I enter the earth and support all beings with my energy; becoming the nourishing moon, I nourish all plants with sap.

slokas: अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रित: ।प्राणापानसमायुक्त: पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम् ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: Becoming the universal fire, I reside in the bodies of living beings. United with the life-breaths, I digest the four kinds of food.

slokas: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टोमत्त: स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च ।वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्योवेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम् ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: I am seated in the hearts of all. From Me come memory, knowledge, and their removal. I am indeed to be known by all the Vedas. I am the creator of the Vedanta, and I am the knower of the Vedas.

slokas: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च ।क्षर: सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: In this world, there are two kinds of beings: the perishable and the imperishable. The perishable includes all creatures, while the imperishable is called the unchanging.

slokas: उत्तम: पुरुषस्त्वन्य: परमात्मेत्युदाहृत: ।यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वर: ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: The Supreme Person is said to be another, the Supreme Self, who, entering the three worlds, sustains them, the imperishable Lord.

slokas: यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तम: ।अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथित: पुरुषोत्तम: ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: Since I transcend the perishable and am even higher than the imperishable, I am celebrated in the world and in the Vedas as the Supreme Person (Purushottama).

slokas: यो मामेवमसम्मूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् ।स सर्वविद्भ‍जति मां सर्वभावेन भारत ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: He who knows Me as the Supreme Person without doubt, he knows everything and worships Me with all his being, O Bharata.

slokas: इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ ।एतद्‍बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: This most secret teaching has been declared by me, O sinless one. By understanding this, one will become wise and fulfilled, O Bharata.
